cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles south of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to move west-northwest into the east-central Gulf of Mexico, then turn north-north-east toward Florida’s Big Bend and continue across Georgia and the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key–Apalachicola area)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf coast of Florida Big Bend and later Georgia–South Carolina–North Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Low (maximum 7% chance of tropical-storm-force winds; gusty squalls possible)
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–4 inches with isolated totals up to 6 inches possible; may cause localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Urban and flash flooding in poor-drainage areas
